snippet.textDisplay: @heerogunkenobi My guess is because they released it so late into the lifespan of the SNES. Didn't Terranigma come out almost a year after the playstation had been introduced and that probably really hurt it's chances of being truly recognized. Plus, Final Fantasy was already an established series and the fact that this new addition to the series was taking such a big leap in design and graphics, as well as moving onto a new system probably really helped boost it's popularity.
snippet.textOriginal: @heerogunkenobi My guess is because they released it so late into the lifespan of the SNES. Didn't Terranigma come out almost a year after the playstation had been introduced and that probably really hurt it's chances of being truly recognized. Plus, Final Fantasy was already an established series and the fact that this new addition to the series was taking such a big leap in design and graphics, as well as moving onto a new system probably really helped boost it's popularity.

snippet.textDisplay:
North America got Chrono Trigger, Europe got Terranigma. Both games are awesome indeed.
Since you're from NA, I understand why you uploaded so much songs from Chrono Trigger but only 4 of Terranigma^^

And like people already mentioned, this game gets melanchonical towards the end. After playing it for the first time I got a complete different feeling then after playing other rpgs

snippet.textDisplay: I've been waiting for this one!  Here's hope you include another Terranigma track, "Resurrection."  It's the song that plays when the continents are reforming.

snippet.textDisplay: @Terrakinetic You know what? You're right. . . The whole game is severely depressing to me. Well no, just the story is really sad. I've gotten pretty far in it before. Something happened and I couldn't finish the game. I don't finish a whole lot of RPGs. . . Something always distracts me away from it just long enough to forget about it and then something happens to the game's save or the game itself or the platform I'm playing on that I can't ever finish a single RPG. I am sadface at this.
snippet.textOriginal: @Terrakinetic You know what? You're right. . . The whole game is severely depressing to me. Well no, just the story is really sad. I've gotten pretty far in it before. Something happened and I couldn't finish the game. I don't finish a whole lot of RPGs. . . Something always distracts me away from it just long enough to forget about it and then something happens to the game's save or the game itself or the platform I'm playing on that I can't ever finish a single RPG. I am sadface at this.

snippet.textDisplay: If I remember correctly, Europe got Terranigma, while North America got Chrono Trigger/Cross. Not that bad of a trade if you ask me. Especially considering, I just played Terranigma on emulator years later :p.

snippet.textDisplay: I'll have to replay both this game and Illusion of Gaia, it's been a while. It had some awesome graphics, music and gameplay, that and a memorable story. You really have to wonder why a game like this isnt on the Virtual Console. There's already an english translation since Europe got the game, unlike North America.
snippet.textOriginal: I'll have to replay both this game and Illusion of Gaia, it's been a while. It had some awesome graphics, music and gameplay, that and a memorable story. You really have to wonder why a game like this isnt on the Virtual Console. There's already an english translation since Europe got the game, unlike North America.
